conclusion: Analyze the work done on the gas during the process from C to A using a PV diagram.
Work done on the gas is negative if expansion and positive if compression.
Process C → A is a compression where volume decreases from 5 L to 2 L at constant pressure.
Work done in an isobaric process can be calculated using W = P ΔV.
At point C, pressure P = 1 × 10^5 Pa.
Volume change ΔV from C to A is -3 L.
Convert volume change to cubic meters: ΔV = -0.003 m^3.
Calculate work done: W = (1 × 10^5 Pa) × (-0.003 m^3) = -300 J.
The work done by the external environment is the opposite: W_external = 300 J.
